description_of_event: The database is in a state where it can no longer accept data if: 1. Application receives a SQL Server error with a Severity Level of 17 or higher. 2. Application fails to connect to the database. 3. Transaction fails with a timeout. These events can be corrected by Infrastructure support.

A transaction failed, but without impacting other transactions.  For instance: 1. Transaction violated a table constraint. 2. Transaction was selected for termination in a resource locking conflict. These events should be examined by a data manager.
Resources could be under heavy load.  Or network traffic is high. These events should be examined by a data manager.
The input record does not conform to the parsing format and therefore cannot be decoded.
The timestamp difference between the sampled time and the reported time exceeds the programmed limit. Keep current limits. Allow limits to be configurable per master stn.
Storage detects no connection to Master (datasource)
Failure to receive new data from a Master Station for more than the programmed limit-1 hour.
No automated zero-precip for Alaska SNOTEL sites.

After conversion from an encoded transmission format to binary computer format, the value fails to conform to the rules for the binary range, or is not a number, or the value after conversion exceeds the column width in the target table.  An example would be a encoded transmission value that decoded to be 1023 degrees Fahrenheit while the table column does not allow for temperatures above 999.

The input record does not match a given site and sensors defined to the database.  Indicates that either the database has the wrong group & channel sensor definitions, or that the site is sending more sensors than are defined in the database for the group.
Low battery message sent by the site radio.
All 4 sensor records for a hydraprobe sensor must be defined to use the same equation type.  If not, log this event.  Do not store any data value for the sensor in the sta_obs table.
The station received for processing by storage is not defined in the database
The master station received for processing by storage is not defined in the database
A scheduled fetch has completed
The station received subhourly data for non-group 16 data not on last hour of year
Storage generates a data ring to store DDD data temporarily, which is a file. This event occurs when Storage could not find the file.
A parse error occcurred in master information - station id unknown
An undefined catastrophic event
An undefined worrisome system event
WARNING log message from OpenDCS
FATAL or FAILURE log message from OpenDCS
The connection to an external LRGS was successful
